page.title: 08SKIPSEA SEWAGE STATION
page.content: We went to{Skipsea Sewage Station. We went on to the top of a building. There were lots of germs and we weren't to touch anything. There were some concrete walls with small water alleys and little waterfalls. It didn't smell as much as we thought. There were a pair of big motors which drove around some blades which chopped up the solids.The water was a shade of light grey.The{settlement {tanks}looked like dirty swimming pools. In the tanks the sludge and the liquid separate. The {filtration beds are round concrete tanks full of stones.They are covered with bacteria, millions of tiny creatures which you would need a microscope to see.The bacteria help to purify the water by eating away at the impurities in the sewage.There are four blue metal arms which spray water onto these stones.
